 What concerns me more than that, it how people can be so foolish to be duped into believing that these new allegations are even possible. 
 
 First off, as a paramedic, I can tell you without a doubt that people who collapse in cardiac arrest for 40-70 minutes are dead. Not just brain dead, but dead dead. D-E-D dead. The only time people are resuscitated after substantial periods of time are in cases of cold water immersion, and even these are few and far between (and I somewhat doubt Terri was found in a tub of ice water). The longest period of time I had ever seen anyone down only to regain a pulse was approximately 10 minutes. The only reason this patient regained a pulse was because I pumped him full of enough Epinephrine to kill a horse. As you might guess, his pulse only lasted as long as the drug did. (as we like to say: if you give enough epi you can get a pulse out of a rock). There is no way she was down for 40-70 minutes prior to EMS, another 5 before EMS arrived, and then was able to be resuscitated with limited cardio-pulmonary damage. It just does not happen.
